I am a Fx artist specialize in Fx simulation and procedural animation.
I am located in Los Angeles with {years} years of experience working at studios including Disney Animation, ILM, Pixar, Dreamworks TV and The Mill.
I enjoys creating unique graphics and solving technical challenges with nodes and codes.

When I am free I like to take pictures, bouldering and brew coffee.

# Colophon
I build this website mostly for recording the more technical aspect of projects that is hard to show in a reel

Also for storing my notes and process when I work on project
I want this site to look simple and unique, avoid cookie-cutter UI components
Leave out planty of breathing room, only show necessary info

## Features
- Responsive design
- Edit content using Markdown
- Manage content with Frontmatter CMS in VSCode
- Emojis

## Issue encounter
Compositing a compositVideoClip on a video cause the edge to be pixalated. It looks like it's an alpha issue. To get around this, I just export the text as individual object,
instead of a compositVideoClip. 
[Probably related bug](https://github.com/Zulko/moviepy/issues/1472)

```python
combine_clip_text =CompositeVideoClip([title_clip,studio_clip,description_clip],size=(1920*2,1080*2))
combine_clip =CompositeVideoClip(video,combine_clip_text)
```

# How to use Copernicus the wrong way
> **`WIP post`**
- I was trying to use **Copernicus** as a Nuke replacement, 
- there isn't a redirection of what replace what 


> TODO:
> - pictures of node, examples
## Common nodes nuke equivalent
| Copernicus |  Nuke|
|--------|----|
| File | Read|
| over | blend|
| noise | fractalnoise|
| remap | fit+ramp|
| bright | grade gain|
| hsv | satuation, value, hue|
| transform | transform|
| channel swap/add/split/extract | shuffle|
| glow | glow|

### Interesting nodes
- dilateerode = dilate
- chromaticaberration

## Creating source
polygon to volume with vdb
- more simple but noise is harder to control compare to particles
point to volume
- better control with attributes on points
- rasterize after
### Volumerasteriseattributes
#### Coverage
Name of the point attribute that stores the coverage (or influence) of each particle. If the coverage attribute does not exist, 
each particle is assumed to have a coverage of 1.
#### Attribute Rules
Different ways to interpolate particles values into voxel, control per attributes
Cheat sheet for using ffmpeg to convert files, video to frames, frames to video

```bash
video to gif
ffmpeg  -i invideo.mp4 -vf "palettegen" -y out_palette.png
ffmpeg  -i invideo.mp4 -i out_palette.png -lavfi "paletteuse" -y out.gif


pic to h.264 mp4
ffmpeg -r 60 -f image2 -s 1920x1080 -i pic%04d.png -vcodec libx264 -crf 25  -pix_fmt yuv420p test.mp4
-r is the framerate (fps)
-crf is the quality, lower means better quality, 15-25 is usually good
-s is the resolution
-pix_fmt yuv420p specifies the pixel format, change this as needed

show list of supported codecs:
ffmpeg -codecs
ffmpeg -formats

multithreading
use all threads
-threads 0

ffmpeg -i jumper_breakdown.mov -r 24 -vcodec libx264 -crf 16 -pix_fmt yuv420p -c:a libfdk_aac -b:a 320k -vbr 3 -threads 0 jumper_breakdown_low.mov


ffmpeg -f image2 -start_number 1480 -i electric_v1.%d.png -vf "palettegen" -y out_platette.png

ffmpeg -i byProcessionBreakdown.mov -r 24 -vcodec libx264 -crf 25 -pix_fmt yuv420p -threads 0 byProcessionBreakdown_low.mov
```
Code I used in the pass to process files with python

```python

from os import listdir, rename
from os.path import abspath, split, join,splitext
import sys
import glob

def main():
	tdir = abspath(sys.argv[1])
	paths = listdir(tdir)
	for path in paths:
		filepath, ext = splitext(path)
		head, filename = split(filepath)
		if (filename[-3:]=="(1)"):
			newpath = join(tdir,filename[:-4]+ext)
			print join(tdir,path)
			print newpath
			rename(join(tdir,path),newpath)

if __name__ == "__main__":
	main()
```
